The strawberry and balsamic combination will pair beautifully with the Paper Plane. And, of course, fresh basil from your garden will add a lovely brightness to the dish.

Now, toasting bread for bruschetta is an art, but don't worry, I've got some tips to help you achieve that perfect crispy-outside, soft-inside texture:

**Choose the right bread:**

* Look for a rustic bread with a dense, chewy texture, like a baguette or ciabatta. Avoid soft, fluffy breads like white sandwich bread.
* Day-old bread is perfect for bruschetta, as it's drier and will hold up better to toasting.

** Toasting methods:**

1. **Oven toasting:** Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Slice the bread into 1/2-inch thick slices and place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Toast for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is crispy on the outside and still soft on the inside.
2. **Grilling:** Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Slice the bread into 1/2-inch thick slices and brush with olive oil. Grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the bread is crispy and slightly charred.
3. **Pan toasting:** Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Slice the bread into 1/2-inch thick slices and brush with olive oil. Toast for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the bread is crispy and golden brown.

**Tips for achieving crispy-outside, soft-inside bread:**

* Use a lower oven temperature (400°F) to prevent the bread from cooking too quickly and becoming too crispy.
* Keep an eye on the bread while it's toasting, as it can go from perfectly toasted to burnt quickly.
* Use a serrated knife to slice the bread, as it will help prevent the bread from tearing and create a cleaner cut.
* Don't overcrowd the baking sheet or skillet, as this can cause the bread to steam instead of toast. Toast in batches if necessary.

By following these tips, you should be able to achieve that perfect crispy-outside, soft-inside texture for your bruschetta. Enjoy!
